intro: Haeupleria ovata, commonly known as the ovate haeupleria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
